result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon Lee Dertz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with Victim, unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact for time with the children if approved by agent and Family Court.
No Facebook posts about the victim.

Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Victim, unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact for time with the children if approved by agent and Family Court.
-No Facebook posts about the victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment, or SSI/SSDI.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing in court, court VACATED the STAYED bench warrant. Defense counsel provided verification of Medical Records and a Justice Point appointment reminder with the incorrect appointment date. Documents reviewed and returned to defense. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Plea & Sentencing date. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz NOT in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for  a Plea & Sentencing date.  Defendant NOT in court. Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant is currently in the hospital. Discussion regarding stayed warrant and defendant's non appearance. Court continued the stay of the warrant and set matter for a Calendar Call date. Defense counsel to provide verification to the court of defendant's hospitalization by next court date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. Case called to address Justice Point Violation: Missed Office Contact. Defense request to impose, but stay a bench warrant is GRANTED. Case adjourned for previously scheduled Plea & Sentencing date of 6/16/2015 at 1:30 PM. Bench warrant imposed, but stayed to next court date.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rhonda D

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Shannon Lee Dertz in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
